comment: A plum finish with a bit of peat compared to the Hibiki Harmony

Nose: sharp fruit and floral. A whiskey doesn’t even come to mind.

Taste: light sweetness, no spicy tongue bite at all. Then a nice level of peat and glorious alcohol fumes fill your sinuses. Finishes with a plum taste and a little warmth.
Nice floral and fruity aroma. A pleasant whisky to enjoy on ice.
Floral / honey sweet / orange. Get a little spice from the wood.
Whisky Exchange Sample. Very floral and flagrant with notes of vanilla, caramel, white chocolate, plums, and raspberries.

Nose- ginger, mushy bananas, butterscotch, vanilla

Palate- bananas, caramel, ginger spice, light smoke, vanilla, butterscotch

Finish- medium, creamy finish with notes of butterscotch and light smoke

Really really nice overall. Fantastic nose, matching palate, and a finish that is just good enough. Could be longer, but the banana on the nose and palate is really enticing to me. I wish I could find this on shelves, but unfortunately, since it’s discontinued, I won’t be seeing another. Would be a perfect ~$80 drinker.
Tastes so much more Mr. Miyagi rather than Rob Roy or Braveheart. I prefer the taste of the Scots to the Japs I guess (Bruichladdich rocks!) but this is well worth the price of a dram.
